topics: Overview of the course: introduction to R and financial econometrics
Seasonality, Stationary and Unit-Root Processes, Cointegration
Multivariate models: VAR and VECM models
Value at Risk & extreme value theory
Principle component analysis (PCA) and Factor Models
Projects Presentations – 2 and Final Project Report

grading.policies: Late submission policy: 20% of the total points will be deducted for work received 1-6 days late; work received more than one week late will receive 0 points.

policies.late_work: 20% of the total points will be deducted for work received 1-6 days late; work received more than one week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: Assignments may be submitted to www.turnitin.com for originality evaluation. Academic impropriety includes cheating and plagiarism.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides accommodations for students with documented disabilities through the Office of Disability Services.

additional_info.course_format: The class will combine class presentations, discussions, exercises, and case analysis.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills; navigating Canvas.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.course_description: This course will cover the main topics of the analysis of time series to evaluate risk and return of the main products of capital markets.
learning_outcomes: Understand the foundations of financial time series data, including high-frequency data
Apply models and methods for analysis of financial time series (return and volatility) and risk management.
Recognize the value and also the limits of econometric methods in financial time series.
